intro: Mikania bakeri, commonly known as the creeping morning glory, is a flowering plant native to Central and South America. It is a member of the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its rapid growth and trailing habit. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in clusters, often appearing in the early morning. Its leaves are heart-shaped and covered in fine, silky hairs. Mikania bakeri is often found in moist, disturbed habitats such as stream banks and forest edges.
